home.name: Tomasz Skorupski
home.lead: I am an IT specialist with broad experience across Windows/AD and Linux administration, networking and databases ‚Äî I combine technologies into practical solutions. I worked on infrastructure modernization and process improvements, focusing on system stability and user comfort. Honestly, I don‚Äôt yet have commercial DevOps experience; I‚Äôm actively learning and building my own project (Git, Docker, basic CI/CD pipelines). My strengths are quickly picking up new tools, communication, documentation, and a constant drive to learn. I‚Äôm open to remote roles ‚Äî not only DevOps but also administration/systems and related areas. I‚Äôm looking for a place where I can bring value from day one while growing my cloud and automation skills.
home.caption: Stability ‚Ä¢ Automation ‚Ä¢ Security

about.title: About me
about.p1: Hi! My name is Tomasz Skorupski. Since 2018 I have been working in IT ‚Äì from helpdesk, through system and network administration, to platform and tool development. I combine Windows Server (AD, GPO), Linux/Bash, networks TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VPN and databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server) with React/JavaScript development and DevOps tooling (Git, Docker, CI/CD).
about.p2: I‚Äôve just finished my first longer break in a while and I‚Äôm actively seeking a role aligned with my skills and previous experience. My goal is to grow into a Junior DevOps Engineer / Cloud SysAdmin. In parallel, I‚Äôm building my own application, developing hands-on skills in automation, containerization and CI/CD best practices.
about.p3: Previously, I was responsible for support, environment stability, modernization and improvements as an IT Administrator & Developer Platform at Streetcom.
bullets: I design and improve processes, automating repetitive tasks.
I care about reliability, security and transparency of systems.
I communicate clearly ‚Äì bridging business needs with technology.

facts.statusValue: Actively seeking Junior DevOps / Cloud SysAdmin role

portfolio.title: Portfolio
portfolio.subtitleHtml: My public portfolio is modest for now, as most of my past work was done for employers and cannot be shared openly. In parallel, I‚Äôm building a series of demo projects ‚Äî new items will appear here soon. I publish everything, including smaller and experimental works, on <link>GitHub</link>.

pwaCookbook.title: Mobile Cookbook (PWA)
pwaCookbook.subtitle: Progressive Web App ‚Äî diploma project
pwaCookbook.description: I built a progressive web app (PWA) that helps plan meals based on ingredients available at home. It integrates a recipe database, preparation steps and side‚Äëdish cooking times, while a built‚Äëin timer with sound notification helps control the process. Designed mobile‚Äëfirst, it also works offline and is accessible on any device with a browser. It truly shortens time spent cooking and helps decide ‚Äúwhat to cook.‚Äù Built with React, focusing on performance and UX, as part of my diploma work.

animalsOnePage.title: Interesting Animals - One Page
animalsOnePage.subtitle: Simple One Page website (student project)
animalsOnePage.description: A very simple, static one‚Äëpage website created during studies as part of an assignment. It presents selected, interesting animal species in short sections ‚Äî with basic info and curiosities. I treat it as a small supplementary piece showing consistency in documenting progress. I‚Äôm aware it doesn‚Äôt represent my current skills and I‚Äôll replace it with newer, original projects soon.
